Articles.Content:
Is there any way to stop classing flags dropped, against my active flight count, preferably without using a mod?

from my earlier carrier, I used to drop flags everywhere, mostly as reminders I've been to such-and-such biome, on X date. But they really clutter up my log-in window, where almost 50% of my current flights are just flags.

I have a love/hate with RemoteTech, so my actual flight count spikes erratically, but I currently have 17 "flights" active right now. Consisting of my HKO station, 4 stock RT-capable satellites, and 12 flags scattered around the Kerbin SOI.

Now actually in my specific save, I can easily just unfilter flags from my Tracking Station and active vessel map view, so its just the log in screen that is irritating. It's a flag, it's been planted in the ground and it's impossible to make it take off again, so it should be counting as an active-flight ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

The short answer is no, as far as I'm aware. There's been at least two threads in the suggestions forum about this before:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/103929](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/103929)

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/62903](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/62903)
Try using waypoint manager add on.. you can add your own waypoints as location markers instead.

armagheddonsgw is correct. The stock game counts flags as active flights.

Cheers,

~Claw
